headline: Brown Sugar Banana Bread
description: This brown sugar banana bread is super soft, moist, and packed with rich, deep flavor thanks to lots of ripe, sweet bananas, butter, and cinnamon.

video.description: This banana bread recipe is full of flavor and easy to make from scratch!
video.name: How to Make Brown Sugar Banana Bread

name: Brown Sugar Banana Bread

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan.
Place bananas into a large resealable plastic bag; seal the bag and smoosh bananas with your fingers until well mashed. Set aside.

Mix together brown sugar and butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed until light and fluffy, 1 to 2 minutes. Cut a corner from the plastic bag; squeeze mashed bananas into brown sugar mixture in the bowl. Add egg, milk, cinnamon, and vanilla; beat on medium speed until well combined. Mix in flour, baking powder, baking soda, and kosher salt on low speed just until smooth, about 1 minute. Spread into the prepared loaf pan.
Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned on top and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 40 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Loved it! I added chocolate chips. It was so good.

My go to banana bread recipe! Taste amazing and it’s also very forgiving/versatile. Depending on how many bananas I have, I just go based on that (3-5 any size) and it comes out fine. I also add pinch of nutmeg and use dark brown sugar instead of light for a deeper flavour. I do find with my oven it may take longer than the required time though, so I make muffins instead for a shorter bake (17-20 min).

I loved it, in fact the grandchildren loved it, and one is always suspicious of food! Ha! I did have to go almost an hour though, but I made mine in silicone pans so that may be why. Mine was quite a bit darker than this photo, and I made 2, but only required me to go 1-1/2 times the recipe, it was wonderful! Very moist and super flavorful. Will be great toasted in the morning!
My family and I absolutely love this banana bread.
One of the best banana breads I have made!

This made very yummy banana bread. It was especially good heated up. The bread was pretty dense and moist, but very delicious, and the crust was soft and sticky. I would say maybe add some more spices, and maybe even more cinnamon. I think nutmeg might be a good addition. Very yummy, and was popular with my friends. It's good to use overripe bananas, and also I did not do the plastic bag mashing method I just put them in the bowl with all the other stuff and mashed them in there with a fork, and it turned out fine. I didn't want to waste the plastic. This might only work if the bananas are really overripe though. I also do not have an electric mixer, but it worked perfectly fine by hand.
Enjoyed making this banana bread with my 11 year old daughter. The house smelled amazing!
No changes. Excellent!

The flavor is good, but “4 bananas” leads to a very inconsistent end product! (Some bananas are nearly twice the size of others.). Also, I have no idea who is able to bake this for only 40 minutes! At 40 minutes, the center portion of the bread was still visibly sticky! Even after 50 minutes, the center was still not done but the ends were almost overly done. I ended up turning the oven down to 250 degrees and leaving it in for 10 MORE minutes. The center was finally done, but the ends were over cooked so they got thrown away. Making muffins out of this recipe worked much better, but I just kept checking them and didn’t write down the total cooking time. Next time I will just use a different recipe.
A nice banana bread recipe...only thing I would change is to mash the bananas in a bowl with a fork and skip the plastic bag for obvious reasons.
I followed the recipe and turned out perfect the first time. After I cut it, there were few wet parts in the middle but that was chunks of banana. So delicious, half of it was gone immediately.

Last time I made it, I cooked it 55 minutes at 350 and the middle was gloop. This time it took 75 minutes before a skewer came out reasonably clean, but it's a little browner than I would like on the outside. I think next time I will follow another reviewer's advice and use two eggs.

I made this with my young grandson. After a long workout, I wasn’t sure how well it was going to turn out because it took so long to bake and seemed to still be somewhat gooey in the middle, but my little one scooped some out, ate it, and with a confident expression says “no it’s fine, I think it’s good!” After letting it set for a little while, he was right — it was good!
Absolutely adore this recipe! Banana Bread has been my nemesis for quite sometime, until this recipe!

I made this recipe today. It took about an hour to get it baked. I let it cool completely before we tried it. I followed the recipe exactly.

It is too sweet, I should have cut back on the brown sugar. It had a strong flavor of banana which was good. Though the top of the bread in the middle was kind of gooey, not sure why.

Overall it was fine, but I have made better banana bread.

Loved it. Followed directions exactly, and had everything at room temp. Be sure to beat the sugar and butter well. I did sprinkle coarse sugar on top before baking. I don’t like wet banana bread, so as others suggested, I baked for 60 minutes. Then I turned the oven down to 300 and baked another 20. It was perfect, and I’ll make it again.
Great recipe and results! But I make muffins, my wife loves them!!

I followed the recipe to a T with respect to the ingredients, and it was wonderful! The only difference for me was that it took almost an hour to finish. Not nearly done at 40 minutes on 350. Will definitely make again.

I must have made this 7 or 10 times in the past few months. Everybody loves it. I usually only use 3 bananas. When I use 4 I find I have to add extra flour but I use a gluten free blend because of celiac so that might be why. Also had to sub some vanilla coffee creamer gor some of the milk one time and that's become a permanent change.

Great recipe, I made one change. I sprayed the glass pan with non stick product then I sprinkled cinnamon and sugar all over the bottom of the pan.
I poured in the batter and also sprinkled the cinnamon and sugar on top. This made the outside layer crispy and delicious; and the inside came out soft and moist, my husband loved it! He has Pretty much eaten it all.

This was one of the most delicious recipes I've tried. One tweak I've made, is that I only use one banana, because it tends to get really sweet, and I also added chocolate chips. I was a little worried when it came out of the oven slightly hard, but it's moist on the inside. Overall great breakfast!
It was great!
I added chopped pecans. 1 cup.
So good! Follow exact recipe! I split the batter in 2 pans to bake -- put walnuts in one and butterscotch chips in the other!

Great recipe, and I have tried oh so many banana bread recipes. I had ripe peaches as well as bananas, so I used two of each and it turned out great. I prefer a 9" square baking pan over a loaf pan. It solves the problem of dry edges and a mushy center. This recipe was easy and the brown sugar sends it over the top. You could probably use less sugar, but I think it's good as is. The family loved it and asked me to make more right away, so I've made it 3 times in two weeks.
Good recipe. Only thing I added was some walnuts.

I love this recipe. Doesn’t matter if I have 3 or 4 bananas, it always turns out great. I think the brown sugar is the secret. I follow the recipe and instructions and that’s the key. My grandson always wants this nana bread. I bake it in mini loaf pans. It makes 16 so the calorie count and portion size is about 1/2. Bake for 20 min. Perfection!!!
I only had three bananas, and I had to bake it longer (not sure how much, 15-20 minutes?), but no other changes. It is absolutely delicious.
Only had 1 banana so divided recipe by 4. I did use 1 whole egg. I just put everything in one bowl and beat it It made 5 generous regular sized muffins. They were very good. I will make again
I found my oven needs 55 minutes. Also, I thought adding pistachios would be good and it was! However, after the first try, I found you should shell them first HAHAHAHAHAHAAAAAAAA!!!
In the oven for 20 minutes more with aluminium foil covering the top as not to burn. So moist and delicious. 1st time making banana bread.

I’ve never found a banana bread recipe I enjoy, until I stumbled across this one.

It’s everything you want in a snack bread, and more.

The flavors are perfection. 

The texture—crispy on the edges, incredibly moist and yummy on the inside. 

It does take a bit longer than 40 minutes, and I make a double batch, split between three bread pans. 

It’s lovely with a handful or two of semisweet chocolate chips, and it freezes incredibly well. 

Sometimes I put it in my mini loaf pans and share those.

Perfection. 
Thank you.

Great recipe ! Love it! I add chocolate chips and it never lasts more than a couple hours in my house ! The only thing is that I find you need to cook it double the time in a glass loaf dish so about an hour and a half. Usually just cook until a butter knife comes out clean, it could take so long because I add chocolate chips.
Awesome recipe!! Very moist banana bread.

This is a lovely recipe! I took the cue of a few others on this recipe and cut the brown sugar down to 1/2 c. And the sweetness was just right. And I had to use whole milk yogurt instead of whole milk because I didn’t have milk.....but that was fantastic. Because I took out so much sugar from the recipe I added about a 1/4c of unsweetened applesauce. The bread was moist and flavorful. It disappeared!
Very good and moist not heavy at all
I would say this really came out good. I did pay attention to the notes that other wrote. I added some oil. However, on my on I added more apples (Granny Smith & honey crisp). Delicious!!!
I followed the recipe to T. I added chocolate chips to the recipe. It came really good. Everyone enjoyed it

Definitely make room for cooking time adjustments. Took approximately 1hr and 20 minutes but it mixed up well and smells amazing! I did end up covering/ tenting it with foil half way to avoid burning the top.

I love this recipe, best banana bread Ive ever had, so moist, great flavor! I use half brown sugar and half regular sugar, I only use 2 to 3 bananas and I add nuts but other than that I follow the recipe and its perfect, it definitely takes at least 60 mins to cook though

I did almost everything exactly as it said except I doubled the batch. I didn't realize how big the 1 batch would be. Plus, I had 8 bananas that were about to get tossed. 
I also blended the butter and brown sugar until it was nice and fluffy as I seen another review suggest it. At least 3 maybe 4 minutes. 
Also, I used 1% milk because it was all I had. 
I added walnuts to the dough at the end by folding them in. I covered them with foil and they did rise quite a bit! so I took the foil off. After 10 minutes without, I put it back on because I didn’t want it to dry out. It took 3 or 4 times of me setting 10 more minutes and checking it but it turned out wonderful! I’m not a big baker and I’ve never made bread before either so I’d call this easy. 
I was going to give some to our neighbors but my husband won’t let me. That’s a good sign! 
I’m saving the recipe! I will definitely make it again! Thank you!

This unfortunately turned out to be a disaster! I followed the directions (even went back over it twice since baking it). No ingredient was left out or mis-measured. When the 40 minutes baking time was up, I checked it and the middle of it was still very "soupy". So I baked it 5 minutes longer. I did this twice more at 5 minute intervals and finally took it out of the oven as the sides were starting to get way too brown. Still tested wet in the middle. Set it to cool but after an hour the entire middle of the bread just sunk in. When it was totally cooled I removed it from the pan and cut it in half. Except for the very ends, the bread was like mushy oatmeal. Had to throw it out. The only thing I did differently was to use 2% milk instead of the whole milk. Such a shame. It smelled so wonderful when baking!

My family loved this recipe the only change I made was adding 1 cup of chocolat chips 
Was delicious
delicious and easy, what more do you want?

sorry.. phone glitch! I have made Betty Crockers recipe for DECADES to rave reviews. However, this recipe is MUCH BETTER! so most and decadent! Followed exact other than adding brown sugar to the top before baking. Tomorrow morning I will bake this for Covid stay home church and add pecans too, can hardly wait!
This was my first time making banana bread. I followed this recipe to a T and it was Fabulous! My family loved it too!

This turned out to be a real hit in my house. I made it in muffin tins to be an easy on the go grab, and they went! The recipe yielded 2 dozen good sized muffins, I added a cup of chocolate chips and changed nothing otherwise. Cooked in under 30 mins

So I made this exactly as written other than I used thawed frozen bananas. I picked this recipe because I wanted a moist bread. Well it needs to be amended for cook time...it definitely takes more than 60 minutes! Now that I’ve read other reviews I see others have had the same issue. Unfortunately I mistook my bread to be finished and when I flipped it out of the pan a glob of uncooked dough slopped out of the bread! I somehow missed that spot when I tested with the toothpick. I will give it another try and automatically cook it to 60 minutes or more and hope it doesn’t burn on the bottom! Any tips or tricks? This so let me down...I definitely should have tested it better...
Very moist as stated by all. Definitely more than one hour to bake! Covered with foil at the 45 minute mark. Shut off oven at the hour mark and let it coast on in. Came out okay.
Maybe 3 bananas instead of 4, 4 overwhelms; otherwise it was great tasting. Recipe was easy to follow, and it was made rather quickly.
Amazing recipe! I made the recipe as written a few times now and the only thing I’ve altered was adding chocolate chips on occasion. Amazing perfect with or without. A new must make in our family.

I really liked this one. Nice and dense bread. Not overwhelmingly sweet. Just good flavor. I did add a cup of pecans and had to bake it longer then it said, but I really think it is more of the ovens fault. Really enjoyed this one, will make it again! And Again!

I can’t tell you how many times I have made this recipe. It’s my go to. I have added every fruit, nut and chocolate to this recipe. I have also melted the butter because I didn’t have time to soften, and every time, every time it turns out perfect. 
I will tell you I don’t make this into a bread, but muffins, 350F for 20-25 mins depending on what you added(density). Love it!

This was a good recipe. It was the second one I made in two weeks and the family said they liked the other recipe a little more...it used sour cream. I always add chocolate chips to my banana bread and did so for this one too. If you don't have sour cream, this recipe is great...you won't be disappointed!
Added chocolate chips, amazing!
First time making banana bread! This recipe was exact to its word for taste! Will make again soon!
I made no changes and I am for sure making it again!!!! Everyone Enjoyed it!!!!

The bread turned out delicious, but because 4 bananas is not the same as another 4 bananas, I have struggled to get any consistency, and I'm not going to make this recipe enough times to figure it out. My bananas were on the large side so baking time was almost double.
Loved this! I used whole wheat flour (makes it rich)and also added nutmeg. My new favorite recipe
delicious
Comes out great, love it!!!
I had to adjust to make this bread vegan- but i received very good reviews!

It was good but the batter was super thick so part of it was underdone. So I just removed that part and was able to salvage the rest. I can tell you it was delicious and I would definitely make it again but I think I’ll try a different pan.

A nice banana bread recipe. However, using a plastic bag to mash the bananas is very environmentally unfriendly. Put your bananas in a flat bottom dish and mash them with a fork. Also, it needs one hour of baking time
I followed the recipe almost exactly. We didn’t have whole milk but I used 2%. Xx
Love this recipe!! The only thing is, we reduced the bananas to 3.

This was seriously delicious, but the cook time is very understated. I tried to take it out at 40 minutes, but it was still like pudding. I added 20 minutes, and it was nicely browned (not burned), but still a raw center when we cut into it that far. I'll cook 90 minutes next time, because there WILL be a next time!!

I loved the taste and texture. I made the recipe as written with the exception of cook time. It was still wet in the middle after 40 minutes. It took a full hour to cook through. I was glad to hear that many others had the same issue. It is worth it. I do not like overly sweet banana bread. This one was perfect.
I made it and came out perfect. Moist and delicious. My hubby loves it and definitely will make again.
Love it! I didn’t use baking powered because I didn’t have it and use almond milk instead of regular but still turned out amazing! Will make again!

Easily the nicest texture and very moist, but unfortunately these are lacking any flavour. I even added cloves, nutmeg and all spice. Served to family that prefers the natural flavours of food and even they struggled to find any flavour.

My husband loved it. I added 3/4 c. raisins, as he is a raisin fiend. I also had to use more time than the recipe called for in order for it to bake through. All ovens vary. Have made twice now, and his tennis buddy asked for the recipe, so I think that's a pretty good indication it's yummy.
SOooooo yummy!!!
Came out very good and moist
Bomb.com. Followed this recipe to the "t" and it was moist and tasty. Definitely a crowd-pleaser. I'm keeping this one in the loop!
Looks & smells delicious, can’t wait to cut into it

I sign up for the first time just so I could write this review because it was so bad! I should have read the reviews because it all happened to me. After 90 minutes it came out and I had to saw through the outer crust to find a way too heavy looking finished product. The recipe is deficient in not stating the measurement of bananas. 4 could yield anything from 1 to 3 cups. My 4 yielded 2 cups and that was way too much. I packed the brown sugar because that is what I have never seen a recipe that said not to so that may have added to the problem. It's got a decent taste, but certainly not worth every trying again unless a lot of modifications were done and who has time for that?
This smells AMAZING!! My kids came into the kitchen to ask what smelled so good! It is taking a little longer to bake than what it says. I followed the recipe exactly, but I did add walnuts.
Very moist banana bread. Would try to just mash bananas in a bowl - not sure what the advantage is of using a ziplock bag (and wasting it).

Made this for a women's brunch event and it was a huge hit. Ladies wanted the recipe. It's such nice change from my usual banana bread. Be sure to add the brown sugar on top before baking. It gives a little crunch.

Great banana bread recipe! I used self-rising flour instead, because that's all I had, plus I omitted the cinnamon. It turned out Perfect! The best banana bread I've ever made!!! I think using the brown sugar made the difference.
My family’s favorite banana bread recipe so far. Live the brown sugar taste.
No changes. When I make it again I'd just add some walnuts. Very good!

The part that actually baked was great, but I baked this bread for well over an hour and it was still soup in the middle, farther down than my toothpick went. When I turned it out of the pan, the whole thing disintegrated. I don't know what I did wrong. I followed the recipe exactly but it just did not get done in the middle and the outsides were starting to get too brown. Very sad.

I put it in a longer, narrower bread pan and baked it for 45 mint. Also sprinkled a brown sugar cinnamon topping. It was a good recipe, moist and tasty. It would have been better if I had had some walnuts to add to it.

Full disclosure I made several modifications to make it vegan, but it was really good - almost more of a cake than a bread. I used 1.5 c almond flour, 1 c brown sugar, soy milk, and EnerG egg replacer. Very sweet and a bit dense which I assume was due to the almond flour. Whole family loved it and I'll definitely make it again.
Yummy!!! Do the exact recipe
We dropped 1/4 of the brown sugar. For us, it needed to be in the oven much longer. It's good but I think I'd add chocolate chips the next time. My kids really like it.
Didn’t make any changes and it came out perfect. Made two batches, the first made 24 muffins and two mini loaves. The 2nd batch made one heavy loaf but baked it 75 minutes.
Made this per instructions except I used 2 bananas instead of 4 and adjusted bake time to 1hr 25 minutes. Absolutely scrumptious. Thank you.
Made this per instructions except I used 2 bananas instead of 4 and adjusted bake time to 1hr 25 minutes. Absolutely scrumptious. Thank you.
It had a good flavor but I cooked it for 1 1/2 hours and the middle still was not cooked.
I just made it!! It’s awesome thank you
I added a half cup of chopped walnuts. It was very good. I will keep and use this recipe as my favorite.
I added a half cup of chopped walnuts. It was very good. I will keep and use this recipe as my favorite.

It was delicious.
My husband loved it.

I did not have 4 bananas, so I used 2 bananas and 2 dessert cups of chunked pineapple and I drained the liquid. I put the batter into cupcake liners in a muffin pan. I filled the cups 3/4 full. I baked them at 350 for 30-40 min. It made 24 banana, pineapple cupcakes or muffins. They were moist and very tasty. I will make them again and add a little more cinnamon and ice them with a cream cheese icing. Very tasty and easy to make.
Made individual mini loafs. Will definitely make again!
No changes. It was very delicious!!!
